name: Chance the Rapper
description:
'''Chancelor Johnathan Bennett''' (born April 16, 1993), known professionally as '''Chance the Rapper''', is an American rapper. Born and raised in [[Chicago]], Illinois, he released his debut mixtape ''[[10 Day]]'' (2012) during one of his high school [[Suspension (punishment)#School discipline|suspensions]]. He gained mainstream recognition in 2013 following the release of his second mixtape, ''[[Acid Rap]]''. His third mixtape, ''[[Coloring Book (mixtape)|Coloring Book]]'' (2016), was released to further critical acclaim and commercial success, peaking at number eight on the [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]]. At the [[59th Annual Grammy Awards]], Bennett won [[Grammy Award for Best New Artist|Best New Artist]] and the mixtape became the first [[Streaming media|streaming]]-only album to win a Grammy Award—[[Grammy Award for Best Rap Album|Best Rap Album]]—while it spawned the single "[[No Problem (Chance the Rapper song)|No Problem]]" (featuring [[2 Chainz]] and [[Lil Wayne]]), which won [[Best Rap Performance]]. His debut studio album, ''[[The Big Day (album)|The Big Day]]'' (2019), peaked at number two on the ''Billboard'' 200 and saw moderate critical reception.

In addition to his solo career, Bennett is a member of the Chicago-based collective [[Savemoney]], and is a lead vocalist for the hip hop band the Social Experiment, led by trumpeter [[Nico Segal]]. The band released their album ''[[Surf (Donnie Trumpet & The Social Experiment album)|Surf]]'' in 2015. Bennett has since been prolific in social activism and philanthropic endeavors in his hometown.
